comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Looks like it says "Lindabury," and the picture is almost certainly related to this article: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9403E3DE173FE633A... All four of these men are named in the article as important players in a lawsuit to break up U.S. Steel.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: An earlier NYT article from May 7, 1912 query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9C06EEDC153CE6... has pictures of Brown, Dickinson, and Lindabury.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Thanks for the additional information.  We'll update the source data with a probable date range for this.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content:
Richard Vliet Lindabury (1850-1925), was the chief counsel for the steel corporation
Henry P. Brown, the special examiner
Colton
J. M. Dickinson, the US prosecuting attorney

"Hearings in the Government's suit for the dissolution of the United States Steel Corporation were begun yesterday before Henry T. Brown, the examiner appointed by the Circuit Court for the District of New Jersey, in Room 210 of the Custom House. "

Here is the article mentioned above:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/richard_arthur_norton/4203475901/]
